page.title: 10THE FARM ESTATE AND MANSION
page.content: The mansion has large gardens, a pond and is surrounded by streaches of lawn. Three people work in the gardens. One of the gardeners thinks that the vil_ lage is very peaceful and quiet be_ cause of the no through road. At the front of the mansion there is a high deer leap above a footpath. The man_ sion is set in the middle of the farm estate. Altogether there are 2500 acr_ es, including woodland. Every weekend in the summer Lord and Lady FitzWalter open their gardens to raise money for different charities. On average 2000 people come each year. If you want to go round the gardens you buy a ticket costing 80p. Afterwards you can buy tea and cakes in the old coach house. Different people serve the teas each week. The school children do it sometimes.
